Yesterday at 5:46 PM ·

We’ve got spirit, yes we do! We’ve got spirit, how about you?

We are hosting a new contest this month - decorate a mini-megaphone!

Here’s how it works:
- pay $3 to buy the mini megaphone from any Student Council member or Mrs. Fulks
- decorate the megaphone to fit one of the following categories: sportiest, most unique, most JM pride, or movie/TV show
- turn in your decorated megaphone by September 25th
- judging will take place on September 29th
- prizes will be awarded for first, second and third place for each category!

This contest is open to any JM student in grades 7 through 12. These decorated megaphones will be on display in the middle/high school upper walkway by the high school office.

September 3 at 7:45 AM ·

With yesterday’s news about allowing spectators to high school football games, we are in the process of developing a plan for our football parents. We must still adhere to the 250 rule which includes everyone with inside the facility. We will be in contact with you on how we will be conducting the fall football season.￼￼￼￼
Golf parents will be permitted to attend matches as long as they follow the guidelines set forth by the WPIAL and the golf course regulations.
Unfortunately, the volleyball issue is still out there. We are not permitted to have any more than 25 in the gymnasium at this time.￼ If anything changes in that scenario, we will notify those parents as well. Please remember this is not a Jefferson-Morgan District decision but this is coming from￼ the Governor’s Office.
Middle school softball and middle school football will also have guidelines for which we must follow as well. We do not anticipate any problems there.￼

If you have any questions please notify me.￼

Good Morning,

Please ignore this message if your child is in our cyber program for grades 7-8.

For students in our full-time cyber program in grades K-6, and 7-12:

Students have been enrolled over the past few weeks in the EdOptions cyber program for the courses they need. We were assured courses would “appear” on August 26th for all students to start on time.

As of right now, courses have not “appeared” for our students in their dashboard.

Please be patient with us as we work to resolve this issue immediately.

As soon as we receive confirmation that the courses are available to our students you will receive a notification from us.

A common question from elementary parents is what time do students have to be logged in by. The answer to this question is that there is not a set time for students in grades K-6 to accommodate a variety of childcare setups. The students are to work each day for at minimum an hour per course.

Sorry for this issue, but we are working to resolve it as soon as possible.

Thank you

Some clarification on the PA department of health and safety’s mask mandate as it pertains to public schools:

PA Department of Health and Safety states that Schools may allow students to remove their face coverings when students are:

1. Eating or drinking when spaced at least 6 feet apart;

2. Seated at desks or assigned work spaces at least 6 feet apart; or

3. Engaged in any activity at least 6 feet apart (e.g. face covering breaks, recess, etc.)

We will be working with our reopening task force to determine when masks would be appropriate for students to wear during an educational setting.

A majority of the areas in our schools ARE appropriately socially distant for our students and would not require them to wear a mask .

Thank you
